alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 12 at 1:33PM PDT until July 16 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: .Record and near record high temperatures over the weekend will accelerate snowmelt in the Eastern Sierra in Mono County leading to increasing streamflows and renewed flooding concerns. The highest flows are expected Friday night through Monday morning. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Additional flooding caused by snowmelt. * WHERE...Mono County in east central California. * WHEN...From Friday evening through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from snowmelt may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams. Particularly those that drain higher elevations of the Eastern Sierra. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An incoming heatwave across the Southwest will bring near or record breaking heat this weekend. Consequently, another round of snowmelt runoff will produce dangerous flows on creaks and streams that drain out of the high Sierra. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Recreationalists are advised to use extreme caution near rivers and streams and have a backup plan. Stream crossings may be hazardous, and road or recreation sites could be closed due to flooding impacts
